chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:
items.plainText: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

items.text: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;
items.plainText: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

items.text: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;
items.plainText: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

items.text: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
items.plainText: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

items.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
items.plainText: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

items.text: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
items.plainText: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;

items.text: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
items.plainText: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

items.text: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.
items.plainText: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

items.text: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?
items.plainText: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?

items.text: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.
items.plainText: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.

items.text: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.
items.plainText: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

items.text: I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.
items.plainText: I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.

items.text: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.
items.plainText: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.

items.text: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.
items.plainText: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.

items.text: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.
items.plainText: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.

items.text: And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.
items.plainText: And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.

items.text: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.
items.plainText: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.

items.text: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.
items.plainText: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.

items.text: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.
items.plainText: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

items.text: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.
items.plainText: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.

items.text: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?
items.plainText: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?

items.text: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
items.plainText: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
